column4: Hello, does anybody have a few minutes to help me with what I think is an xorg.conf issue?

Ive just installed ubuntu 7.10, did all the updates, am using the restricted nvidia drivers, and made my second screen a 'twin view'.... But as soon as I saved the changes to xorg.conf and rebooted, my system halts on boot until I hit 'ctrl+alt+del'... It then boots into Gnome, but it didnt mount my other 2 drives as it had before... Any ideas? Im thinking taking xorg.conf back will do the trick.
did you try writing to xorg from nvidia settings?
Yeah, thats how I made it the twin view in the first place.
I think thats how this problem started.
I have never had luck with nvidia settings writing to xorg  but then I always  enable twinview manually after logging in just incase I have an application or game that doesn like twinview
So any ideas on how to take it back to how I had it before?
did you check in the xorg.conf to see if indeed nvidia wrote anything there?
I see that there is a .backup file, but Im not sure if I should try to rename it..... The backup file is also made by nvidia settings.
you could try a sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg  as a last resort  but check again in xorg to see what was changes first
what does that do? Im really new to xorg.conf, and I dont think I could notice what changed.
ok  go to http://pastebin.ca   paste the contents of /etc/ X11/xorg.conf   hit the submit button and paste the link it gives you here

well it looks like nvidia settings indeed wrote to the xorg  in the last section  Section "Screen"  you can most likely comment that section with #  and restart x  to see if it goes to normal single monitor use  if not you wil have to remove the   #  you place there in text console if it doesn boot and y ou do that with  sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf     do you know how to do t hat/
you know how to do the nano  in text console?
ok just go slow with it and test that commented section to see if that works
